Module app
Package app

Class Main

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
app.Main
public class Main extends javafx.application.Application
The Main class is the entry point of the JavaFX application. It sets up the primary stage and provides methods for navigating between scenes.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      This method is the entry point of the JavaFX application. It is called when the application is launched and sets up the primary stage. The primary stage of the JavaFX application.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application

    • navigateTo

      public static void navigateTo(String fxml)

    • navigateToMenuWithRole

      public static void navigateToMenuWithRole(String fxml, boolean isManager)
      Navigates to the specified FXML view and initializes it based on the user's role. This method dynamically loads the FXML file, retrieves its controller, and calls the initialization method with the user's manager status.
      Parameters:
      fxml - The name of the FXML file to navigate to (without the ".fxml" extension).
      isManager - A boolean indicating whether the current user is a manager. True if the user is a manager, false otherwise.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main entry point for the application. This method launches the JavaFX application.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments passed to the application. Not used in this application.

    • setIsManager

      public static void setIsManager(boolean b)
      Sets the manager status for the current session. This method should be called with the appropriate manager status when a user logs in.
      Parameters:
      b - The manager status to set. True if the user is a manager, false otherwise.

    • getIsManager

      public static boolean getIsManager()
      Retrieves the manager status for the current session. Use this method to check if the current user is recognized as a manager in the application.
      Returns:
      True if the current user is a manager, false otherwise.
